articles.title: Kim Yong Dae Meets Franklin Graham
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae Meets Franklin Graham
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Reverend Franklin Graham of the United States who is president of Samaritan's Purse, a non-governmental organization, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
					 Franklin Graham asked Kim Yong Dae to convey the warm regards of U.S. religious leader Reverend Billy Graham to General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that he would make all efforts to develop the relations between the U.S. and the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Franklin Graham
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Franklin Graham
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Reverend Franklin Graham of the United States who is president of Samaritan's Purse, a non-governmental organization, on a visit to the DPRK.
					The gift was handed to Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Franklin Graham on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Franklin Graham
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Franklin Graham
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun met and had a friendly conversation with Rev. Franklin Graham who is president of Samaritan's Purse, a non-governmental organization of the United States, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: DPRK's Will to Contribute to Attaining UN Millennium Goal Reiterated
articles.content:
DPRK's Will to Contribute to Attaining UN Millennium Goal Reiterated
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will boost the friendly and cooperative relations with UNESCO and all its member states and make a positive contribution to the international efforts to attain the UN millennium goal of development in the future, too, said the head of a DPRK delegation when addressing the plenary meeting of the 35th General Conference of UNESCO on October 9.
					He went on:
					
					This year marks the 35th anniversary of the DPRK's entry into UNESCO.  In this period the DPRK has taken an active part in the activities of UNESCO, consistently respecting its charter, and the interaction and cooperation between the DPRK and UNESCO have steadily developed, expanding the area of cooperation and raising the quality and effectiveness in implementing the assistance projects. 
					
					He pointed out that to ensure that the cultural properties illegally displaced in the past are returned to the countries they belonged to is a political matter for putting an end to the practices of evading the settlement of past wrongs and to take international measures for it has become an important issue in promoting reconciliation among nations and world peace and security. 
					
					He supported the adoption of a "declaration of principles relating to cultural objects displaced in connection with the Second World War".
					
					Referring to the fact that the DPRK has entered a turning phase in building a rich and powerful country under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted that the DPRK's efforts for economic construction would amount to joining the international community in its efforts to attain the UN millennium goal of development and making a positive contribution to such efforts.
					
					Independence, peace and friendship are the invariable idea of the foreign policy of the DPRK, he stressed.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Idea on Great National Unity
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Idea on Great National Unity
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung made an address at the Pyongyang City rally held in welcome of his triumphal return home on October 14, 1945 after the liberation of the country.
					 He writes in his reminiscences "With the Century" Vol. 8 (Continuing Edition): "The gist of my speech that day was great national unity".
					
					He, basing himself on the Juche idea, elucidated the national problem from a new angle and put forward the unique idea of the great national unity in his early years. He thoroughly carried out the idea in the long historical course of struggle to liberate the country, build a new country and reunify the country, thus creating a brilliant example of the great national unity.
					
					After the liberation of the country he founded the Party as a party for the working people and convened the Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea in Pyongyang in April Juche 37 (1948), thus accomplishing the historical cause of rallying political parties and patriotic forces of all strata as one.
					
					He, who had poured his heart and soul into the great national unity throughout his life, authored the work "10-point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" in April 1993 even at the last moments of his life and thus indicated the patriotic way for national unity and reunification.
					
					Under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the President's idea of the great national unity is shining as the banner of patriotism for the reunification that the entire nation should uphold.
					
					Kim Jong Il made public famous works "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" in August 1997 and "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" in April 1998, which carry the President's idea of the great national unity. He, in the works, emphasized that the Korean nation will certainly achieve the great national unity under the banner of the national reunification, noting that the internal force of the national reunification is the Korean nation and its might lies in the great national unity.
					
					The Korean people erected the Monument to President Kim Il Sung's Handwritings from His Address at a Rally to Welcome Him on His Triumphant Return to the Homeland and the mural "Cheers of Whole Nation" on October 14, 1987 in commemoration of the historical day when the President made the address at the rally.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Scenario for Aggression on DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Scenario for Aggression on DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- The United States and south Korea held a huddle in Hawaii early in August last at which they discussed and agreed on the matter of jointly coping with contingency on the Korean Peninsula and the basic principle and the specific area of cooperation in this respect, according to foreign press reports.
					Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					The above-said confab was nothing but a huddle for a war of aggression on the DPRK as it was aimed at making the U.S. and south Korea's provocation of another Korean war an established fact and stifling the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					They put the strategy for a large-scale attack on the DPRK, which had long been pushed forward, into an operation plan and rounded it off and finally confirmed it at the Hawaii meeting.
					
					Such frantic action taken by the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers for a war of aggression on the DPRK is designed to seek a way out of the crisis caused by their failure to execute the policy for stifling the DPRK in stepping up their policy of aggression on it.
					
					 The U.S., much upset by its scheme to isolate and stifle the DPRK proving futile as the days go by, seeks to bind south Korea more tightly to its strategy to stifle the latter by force of arms and use Seoul as a shock force for igniting another war of aggression on the Korean Peninsula at any cost.
					
					The security of the DPRK is exposed to a grave threat and the prospect of the situation on the peninsula remains unpredictable due to the U.S. invariable hostile policy towards the former. 
					
					The potential military threat to the DPRK and the unstable situation on the peninsula for which the U.S. and south Korean bellicose elements are to blame compel the DPRK to bolster up its war deterrent for self-defence.
					
					The U.S. and south Korea will be held wholly responsible for all the ensuing consequences, warns the commentary.

articles.title: U.S. Entirely to Blame for Spawning Nuclear Issue on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
U.S. Entirely to Blame for Spawning Nuclear Issue on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Crowley, U.S. assistant secretary of State, recently blustered that the DPRK's denial of nuclear dismantlement would result in further isolation and more stringent sanctions.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary dismisses this as shameless, preposterous and brigandish sophism as the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula is a product of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and its nuclear threat from A to Z.
					
					It was none other than the U.S. that compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrent and, therefore, the U.S. is wholly to blame for the nuclear issue on the peninsula, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					The denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula is, in essence, directly related to the U.S. drop of its hostile policy toward the DPRK and the former's removal of its nuclear threat.
					
					In order to make the Korean Peninsula nuclear-free, it is necessary to make a comprehensive and total elimination of all the nuclear weapons on earth, to say nothing of those in and around south Korea. A prerequisite for global denuclearization is for the U.S., which tops the world's list of nuclear weapons, to cut down and dismantle them, to begin with.
					
					A peace accord should be concluded between the DPRK and the U.S. if the nuclear issue on the peninsula is to be settled.
					
					The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for the conclusion of the peace agreement as it would help clear the Korean Peninsula of the nuclear threat and ensure peace there.
					
					The nuclear issue on the peninsula can be fundamentally settled only when the U.S. repeals its hostile policy toward the DPRK and replaces the Armistice Agreement with a peace accord and the whole Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world become nuclear-free.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Cooperation Called for
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Cooperation Called for
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- It is an invariable will of the DPRK to positively achieve national reconciliation and unity, cooperation and exchange as clarified in the north-south declarations. 
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south of Korea was successfully held at Mt. Kumgang resort on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day this year. The reunion proved once again the inevitability of the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and offered an important occasion for putting spurs to the improvement of the inter-Korean relations in the direction of reconciliation and unity, cooperation and exchange.
					
					It is the requirements of the era and the aspiration of the whole nation for the north and the south to fully cooperate in various fields including economy, social culture and humanitarianism as required by the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The north and the south should continue to carry forward the atmosphere of cooperation and exchange, including the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang and Kaesong and the revitalization of the Kaesong Industrial Zone, on the basis of the recent achievement.
					
					If the north and the south revitalize economic cooperation on the principle of promoting common interests and co-prosperity and on the principle of mutual accommodation and realize cooperation and exchange in social culture, humanitarianism and other fields, it would help them jointly develop and exploit each other's resources and technologies and thus develop the economy on a nationwide scale and re-link the severed bonds of the nation.
					
					The issue of the inter-Korean relations is the internal issue of the nation and, therefore, this can be solved only by the Korean nation responsible for it.
					
					The north and the south should realize dialogue and reenergize the visits and contacts, cooperation and exchange in various fields in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and thus put spurs to the reunification and prosperity of the nation.

articles.title: Anniversary of WPK Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of WPK Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a photo exhibition took place in Mexico, meetings in Mongolia and Bulgaria and a meeting and a film show in Kyrgyzstan from Oct. 2 to 6 on the occasions of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 83rd anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					Displayed at the exhibition hall were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary 
						Kim Jong Il and photographs introducing the Korean people in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					Speeches were made at the meetings.
					
					Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said that the WPK has covered the road of victory and glory, holding high the banner of the Juche idea, the Songun idea, for the past more than six decades under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					Lyudmil Kostadinov, chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that 
						Kim Il Sung formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union 83 years ago, providing the historical roots of the WPK and this made it possible for the party to successfully fulfill its mission as the vanguard of the Korean revolution from the very day of its founding.
					
					N. Bold, chairman of the Centre for the Study of the Juche Idea of Mongolia, said that Kim Jong Il has wisely led the political, military, economic and all other affairs of the country and the struggle for national reunification even under the complicated international situation. 
					
					A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party, noted that the WPK has become a model to be followed by the world progressive political parties for its steadfast revolutionary principle and staunch spirit of independence against imperialism.
					
					The participants of the film show watched Korean films introducing the Lake Chon on the top of Mt. Paektu and the Three-Revolution Exhibition.
					
					A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held in Mongolia.

articles.title: WPK Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
WPK Birthday Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Political figures of Nepal and India published statements on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Former Foreign Minister K. P. Sharma Oli, chief of the International Department of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), said in his statement on October 7 that the Korean revolution pioneered by President Kim Il Sung set an example to be followed by all workers of the world in the revolutionary struggle against all sorts of the imperialist and dominationist exploitation and interference.
					
					He stressed that the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) extends congratulations to General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has steered the Workers' Party of Korea with his Songun revolutionary guidance, ushering in a new era of building a thriving socialist nation and to the WPK and the Korean people.
					
					He voiced firm support and solidarity to the Korean people advancing towards final victory of the cause of Juche.
					
					Hari Singh Khan, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), noted in a statement on October 6 that the founding of the WPK made it possible for the Korean people to dynamically advance along the road of building a new society, the road of socialism, eradicating the aftermath of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 He said that the history and tradition of the WPK, founded and developed by Kim Il Sung, are given steady continuity by Kim Jong Il, who is leading the Korean people along the road of victory.

articles.title: Anniversary of Oct. 4 Declaration Observed in Egypt
articles.content:
Anniversary of Oct. 4 Declaration Observed in Egypt
 Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- Chairman Ahmed Hamrouch and Secretary-General Nouri Abdel Razzak Hussein of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization in Egypt issued a joint statement on October 4 to mark the second publication anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					 Referring to the detailed content of the Declaration for Development of North-South Relations and Peace and Prosperity, the statement said:
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration based on the idea of "By our nation itself", the spirit of national independence, serves as the corner stone of national reunification recognized by all Koreans in the north and the south.
					
					 The October 4 declaration is a programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, a landmark for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The publication of this declaration gave the Korean nation greater confidence and optimism in the reunification of the country.
					
					 We heartily wish the Korean people bigger successes in the efforts for the country's reunification and the independent development of the nation under the banner of the said declarations.

articles.title: Nostalgia Sung in Manjiang
articles.content:
Nostalgia Sung in Manjiang
Pyongyang, October 14 (KCNA) -- One day in April Juche 25 (1936) anti-Japanese heroine
					Kim Jong Suk, together with a woman guerilla, sang her favorite song in her childhood on the bank of a stream in Manjiang, China, yearning for her hometown.
					While looking round the bivouac, Commander Kim Il Sung sang the song “Nostalgia” in a low voice with deep emotion and said the spring made those living in an alien land homesick.
					
					Fascinated by the melody of the song, she entreated him to teach it.
					
					So Kim Jong Suk learnt “Nostalgia” at the stream.
					
					After acquainting himself in detail with her family, the Commander said that she should become a fine woman fighter, a woman revolutionary, in future with the responsibility of being a revolutionary fighting on the sacred revolutionary front with arms in hands.
					
					 Indeed, it was the most significant day and an unforgettable day in her whole life.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae se reune con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae se reune con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Dae, departio el dia 14 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el pastor estadounidense Franklin Graham, presidente de la organizacion no gubernamental "Samaritan's Purse" y su comitiva que le hicieron una visita de cortesia. 
					En la ocasion Franklin Graham encomendo a Kim Yong Dae transmitir al Dirigente Kim Jong Il el cordial saludo que le dirigiera el pastor Billy Graham, lider religioso de Estados Unidos.
					
					Y dijo que hara todos los esfuerzos por el desarrollo de las relaciones entre EE.UU. y Corea.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun departio el dia 14 en un ambiente amistoso en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el pastor estadounidense Franklin Graham, presidente de la organizacion no gubernamental "Samaritan's Purse", y su comitiva quienes le hicieron una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: RPDC contribuira al logro del objeto del desarrollo de milenio de la ONU
articles.content:
RPDC contribuira al logro del objeto del desarrollo de milenio de la ONU
Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- En el futuro tambien el gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fortalecera mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO) y con los paises miembros de esta organizacion internacional y hara activo aporte a los esfuerzos internacionales por alcanzar el objeto del desarrollo del milenio de la ONU.
					Asi senalo el dia 9 el jefe de la delegacion coreana al hacer uso de la palabra en el pleno del 35o periodo de las sesiones de la asamblea general de la UNESCO.
					
					Este ano se cumple el 35o aniversario del ingreso de la RPDC en la UNESCO, dijo y continuo que la RPDC respeto invariablemente la carta de la organizacion y participo activamente en las actividades de esta.
					
					Gracias al desarrollo incesante de las relaciones y cooperacion entre Corea y la UNESCO, se amplio la esfera de cooperacion y se elevaron mas la calidad y la eficiencia de la ejecucion del objeto de colaboracion, agrego.
					
					Asevero que el problema de devolver las reliquias culturales trasladadas ilegalmente en el pasado a los paises correspondientes deviene el problema politico para poner fin a los actos encaminados a evitar la liquidacion del pasado.
					
					Prosiguio que tomar las medidas internacionales para solucionar ese problema se presenta como importante asunto para fomentar la reconciliacion entre las naciones y la paz y seguridad del mundo.
					
					Y apoyo la aprobacion de la "Declaracion de principios sobre los bienes culturales trasladados en el periodo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial".
					
					Bajo la sabia direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il Corea ha entrado en la etapa de viraje de la construccion de la patria prospera, senalo y enfatizo que los esfuerzos de Corea por la construccion economica se incorporaran y contribuiran activamente a los esfuerzos de la sociedad internacional por alcanzar el objeto del desarrollo del milenio de la ONU.  
					
					Recalco que la independencia, la paz y la amistad devienen el invariable ideal de la politica exterior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela la ambicion agresiva de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela la ambicion agresiva de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
  Pyongyang, 14 de octubre (ATCC) -- Segun trascendidos, en un conciliabulo sostenido a principios de agosto en Hawai, Estados Unidos y el Sur de Corea discutieron y acordaron el problema de enfrentarse en comun con el tiempo de emergencia de la Peninsula Coreana, el principio fundamental y el domino de colaboracion concreta para ese particular.
					  Ese conciliabulo fue una conspiracion para hacer de una realidad el estallido de la segunda guerra coreana y atacar con fuerzas armadas a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.  
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 14 y continua:
					
					  Ellos dieron el acabado a la estrategia de ataque de gran envergadura contra la RPDC que han venido impulsando desde hace mucho tiempo y lo confirmaron finalmente en esa cita en Hawai.
					
					  El objeto de tales locuras belicas de los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos reside en que estos pretenden buscar la salida de la crisis causada por el fracaso de la politica de aplastamiento a la RPDC en el fortalecimiento de la politica de agresion contra esta.
					
					  Atemorizado ante el hecho de que no surte efecto su intento de aislar y aplastar la RPDC, EE.UU. trata  de provocar a toda costa la guerra de agresion en la Peninsula Coreana  introduciendo el Sur de Corea en su estrategia de aplastamiento militar contra la RPDC y presentandolo como brigada de choque para provocar nueva guerra en dicha peninsula.  
					
					  Debido a la invariable politica hostil de EE.UU. a la RPDC, esta se ve amenazada gravemente y la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se torna mas compleja.
					
					  Tal amenaza militar de los belicistas yanquis y surcoreanos y la situacion inestable de la Peninsula Coreana posibilitan a la RPDC tomar el camino del fortalecimiento del disuasivo belico autodefensivo.
					
					  Toda la responsabilidad que emane de eso recaera sobre EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea.
